Methods & Definitions

Blaze Intelligence blends computer vision, predictive modeling, and real-time telemetry to produce the metrics you see across the platform. This quick reference outlines the core methods and how we define championship readiness.

Modeling Approach

  • Pattern Recognition Engine – ensembles of gradient boosted trees and recurrent neural networks tuned on MLB, NFL, NCAA, and NBA datasets.
  • Championship Probability – Monte Carlo simulations across 50K+ seasons per refresh incorporating injury risk, schedule leverage, and opponent efficiency.
  • Decision Velocity – weighted average of scouting cycle time, coaching adjustments, and operations response benchmarks.

Key Definitions

  • Performance Accuracy: Rolling 30-day forecast accuracy vs. observed outcomes.
  • Team Readiness: Composite of health, depth, and execution metrics normalized to 0–100.
  • Clutch Factor: Late-game win probability added per athlete adjusted for opponent strength.
  • Velocity Score: Time-to-insight for front office and coaching staff, expressed on a 1–10 scale.

Data Sources

Live feeds from partner APIs, internal scouting reports, biometric wearables (Cardinals/Titans/Longhorns/Grizzlies), and Blaze engineered tracking sensors.
